meanings.definition: Using more words than necessary to express an idea
meanings.sent1: Her periphrastic explanation made the simple concept confusing.
meanings.sent2: The periphrastic description of the movie plot was unnecessarily long.
meanings.sent3: His periphrastic storytelling had everyone yawning.
meanings.sent4: The periphrastic route she took to explain the problem led to more confusion.
meanings.sent5: The periphrastic language used in the manual made it hard to understand.

meanings.sent1: The periphrastic response left me unsure of what he meant.
meanings.sent2: She gave a periphrastic answer instead of a simple yes or no.
meanings.sent3: His periphrastic excuse for being late was hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: The periphrastic explanation only added to the confusion.
meanings.sent5: The periphrastic way he avoided the question was frustrating.

meanings.definition: Circumlocutory or indirect in speech or writing
meanings.sent1: Her periphrastic writing style made the essay hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: The periphrastic language used in the speech made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: His periphrastic way of giving directions got us lost.
meanings.sent4: The periphrastic manner in which he spoke left us puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The periphrastic explanation only served to confuse the listeners.
